text:
Bizuayehu Tesfaye/Associated Press

Ronda Rousey apparently has her next opponent lined up after accepting a challenge from Nia Jax for a match at Money in the Bank.

Although many WWE matches are set up from bitter feuds, that was not the case as Rousey explained at NBCUniversal Upfront.

"We are very civil and professional ladies, so Nia did just challenge me for Money in the Bank to come after her title," she said, per Samantha Schnurr of E! Online. "I happily oblige respectfully, so I can sit next to her."

The upcoming pay-per-view is set for Sunday, June 17, in Chicago.

Rousey made her in-ring debut for WWE at WrestleMania 34 as part of a tag team match alongside Kurt Angle, taking on Triple H and Stephanie McMahon. However, the upcoming battle will not only represent her start of competing in the women's division, it will give her a chance at a title.

Jax is the current Raw women's champion, beating Alexa Bliss for the belt at WrestleMania. While she has already successfully defended her title, she knows Rousey represents a different challenge.

"I've never been in a ring with somebody like Ronda," Jax said. "She's one of a kind, so there definitely has to be an alternation to my regimen and I'm looking forward to it."

While Rousey is new to the sport, her mixed martial arts background makes her fun to watch in the ring, potentially creating an exciting battle at the next big PPV.
title: Ronda Rousey Accepts Nia Jax's Challenge for Match at WWE Money in the Bank
